translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sereyya
there is no formation of the Teacher;
I pay homage to you, O Wise One,
I pay homage to you, O Supreme One;
In knowledge there is no one equal to you,
as far as knowledge is supreme.
I rejoiced in heaven for an eon;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of knowledge and perception.
For seven hundred eons from now,
there will be one with a lotus in the ford;
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ñāṇasaññiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ñāṇasaññikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus did the venerable elder Ñāṇasaññika recite these verses.
This is the story of the Elder Ñāṇasaññika.
